author: bergmeister
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

The docs [here](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docker) state the following example:
````powershell
docker run -it microsoft/nanoserver-insider-powershell 'C:\program files\powershell\powershell' -c '$psversiontable'
````

Expected behavior
-----------------

Advertised example works and displays version information.

Actual behavior
---------------

```none
docker: Error response from daemon: container 204a5e6784a7f7bbadc8095b72efb518475121a0277f3d3e566e46856e8ec921 encountered an error during CreateProcess: failure in a Windows system call: The system cannot find the file specified. (0x2) extra info: {"CommandLine":"'C:\\program files\\powershell\\powershell' -c '$psversiontable'","User":"ContainerUser","WorkingDirectory":"C:\\","Environment":{"PSCORE":"C:\\Program Files\\PowerShell\\PowerShell.exe","ProgramFiles":"C:\\Program Files"},"EmulateConsole":true,"CreateStdInPipe":true,"CreateStdOutPipe":true,"ConsoleSize":[30,120]}.
```

Environment data
----------------

Windows 10 1803 (10.0.17134.1) using latest Docker CE (18.03.1-ce, build 9ee9f40)

comments.author: mlocati
comments.body:
For me everything is working as expected:
```powershell
PS C:\> docker version
Client:
 Version:      18.03.1-ce
 API version:  1.37
 Go version:   go1.9.5
 Git commit:   9ee9f40
 Built:        Thu Apr 26 07:12:48 2018
 OS/Arch:      windows/amd64
 Experimental: false
 Orchestrator: swarm

Server:
 Engine:
  Version:      18.03.1-ce
  API version:  1.37 (minimum version 1.24)
  Go version:   go1.9.5
  Git commit:   9ee9f40
  Built:        Thu Apr 26 07:21:42 2018
  OS/Arch:      windows/amd64
  Experimental: false
PS C:\> (Get-WmiObject Win32_OperatingSystem).Version
10.0.17134
PS C:\> docker run --rm -it microsoft/nanoserver-insider-powershell 'C:\program files\powershell\powershell' -c '$psversiontable'
WARNING: Appended Windows PowerShell PSModulePath

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16257
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body:
Hmm, are you on a physical or virtual machine? What is the OS version of your client? Are you running the docker command from cmd.exe as well?
I am wondering if it is because I am using an Azure VM (but all other Docker images are fine, hence why I suspected an image problem) or because I am already on Windows 1803 (which is full of bugs).

comments.author: mlocati
comments.body:
I am using a physical PC with Windows 10 Pro - April 2018 Update (version 1803 build 17134.1).
My Docker version is the one [I posted above](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6826#issuecomment-386973850).
In [my post](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/6826#issuecomment-386973850) I was using PowerShell.
On CMD we have to change the syntax a bit (cmd doesn't understand `'` to enclose arguments):
```bat
C:\>docker run --rm -it microsoft/nanoserver-insider-powershell "C:\program files\powershell\powershell" -c "$psversiontable"
WARNING: Appended Windows PowerShell PSModulePath

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      6.0.0-beta
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-beta.5
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.16257
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Thanks @mlocati The single quotes in cmd.exe were the problem, I kept using cmd.exe to avoid having to decorate the sample script from the PSSA issue with double single-quotes for escaping. Sorry, this was my fault, I should've remember this gotcha.

title: Docker image 'nanoserver-insider-powershell': Documentation outdated or image problem
